entries.content:
Session started - Moti asked to continue work on thinking indicator from last session. Found 3 recent memories about:
1. Collapse arrow icon CSS filter implementation (INCOMPLETE - animation issue)
2. Collapse/expand implementation (INCOMPLETE - needs refactor)
3. Complete collapsible system with animated arrow (marked SUCCESS)

Git status shows modifications to:
- ReasoningMessageBuilder.js
- ReasoningChunkHandler.js  
- message-thinking.css

Need to review current state and determine what still needs to be completed.
Task: Change collapse UX - collapsed state should show ~30px preview of thinking content (no scroll, overflow hidden) instead of completely hiding it. Need to understand current implementation first.

Understanding current collapse implementation:

STRUCTURE:
- .thinking-container (parent)
  - .thinking-indicator (header with arrow icon)
  - .thinking-text (content that gets collapsed)

CURRENT BEHAVIOR:
- Expanded: .thinking-text has max-height: 10000px
- Collapsed: .thinking-text has max-height: 0 (completely hidden)
- Uses CSS transition on max-height for smooth animation
- .collapsed class is toggled on .thinking-container

NEW REQUIREMENT:
- Collapsed should show ~30px preview (not completely hidden)
- No scrolling (overflow: hidden)
- Default state: collapsed with 30px preview

IMPLEMENTATION COMPLETE:

Changes made:
1. CSS (message-thinking.css:120): Changed collapsed max-height from 0 to 30px
2. ReasoningMessageBuilder.js:88: Added 'collapsed' class to default className
3. ReasoningChunkHandler.js:100: Added 'collapsed' class to default className

Result: All thinking containers now start collapsed by default with 30px preview visible (no scroll, overflow hidden).

Next: Test to verify it works correctly in both streaming and completed message scenarios.
Moti wants to add fade gradient overlays (top and bottom) to thinking containers when collapsed. Says we already do this in message list. Need to find the existing implementation pattern to reuse it.

FOUND EXISTING PATTERN in message-list-layout.css:

MESSAGE LIST FADE GRADIENT PATTERN:
- Parent container: position: relative (required for absolute positioning)
- Two absolute div overlays:
  1. .message-list-gradient-top: top fade (22px height, gradient to bottom)
  2. .message-list-gradient-bottom: bottom fade (22px height, gradient to top)
- CSS: linear-gradient using var(--bg-primary) to transparent
- pointer-events: none (don't block clicks)
- z-index: 10 (above content)

Need to apply same pattern to .thinking-text when collapsed.

COMPLETE - Copied EXACT gradient pattern from message-list-layout.css:
- linear-gradient(to bottom, var(--bg-primary), transparent) for top
- linear-gradient(to top, var(--bg-primary), transparent) for bottom
No provider-specific colors needed - just fade text to transparent!
Moti wants to add 15px margin to collapsed thinking indicator. Need to clarify which margin (top/bottom/all sides).
